2015-01-03 09:40:29+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Scraped from <200 http://stackoverflow.com/tags/php/info>
	{'descr': u'<div class="welovestackoverflow" id="wiki-excerpt" style="display:none">\r\n                <p>PHP is a general-purpose, open source scripting language widely used in web development.</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p><strong><a href="http://www.php.net/" rel="nofollow">PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor</a></strong> is a widely used, general-purpose <a href="/questions/tagged/scripting-language" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'scripting-language\'" rel="tag">scripting-language</a> that is especially suited for web development. The latest stable release, development changes, and development branches can be found on <a href="http://www.php.net/" rel="nofollow">the PHP website</a>. </p>\n\n<p>For a quick start with PHP, you might use one of these applications, which include the <a href="http://httpd.apache.org" rel="nofollow">Apache web-server</a> and <a href="http://www.php.net" rel="nofollow">PHP</a> [besides other components]:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://ampps.com" rel="nofollow">AMPPS</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.apachefriends.org/" rel="nofollow">XAMPP</a> (For Windows, Mac OS X &amp; Linux)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.mamp.info/" rel="nofollow">MAMP</a> (For Mac OS)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.wampserver.com/en/" rel="nofollow">WampServer</a> (For Windows)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.easyphp.org/" rel="nofollow">easyPHP</a> (for Windows)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.usbwebserver.net/en/" rel="nofollow">USBWebserver</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://open-server.ru" rel="nofollow">Open-Server</a> (for Windows)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>As of version 5.4.0 PHP provides a built-in web server, which can be started using following command.</p>\n\n<pre><code>php -S localhost:8000\n</code></pre>\n\n<p>After executing the command above, server will listen on port <code>8000</code> using current working directory as its document root. See <a href="http://pl1.php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.webserver.php" rel="nofollow">PHP manual</a> for more information.</p>\n\n<blockquote>\n  <p><strong>Notice:</strong> To make an online demo for your question, you may use <a href="http://codepad.org/" rel="nofollow"><strong>codepad</strong></a>, or <a href="http://3v4l.org" rel="nofollow" title="3v4l"><strong>3v4l</strong></a> which acts like <a href="/questions/tagged/jsfiddle" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'jsfiddle\'" rel="tag">jsfiddle</a> but for PHP.\n  However, all relevant code should still be included in your question or answer. </p>\n</blockquote>\n\n<h2>PHP Version</h2>\n\n<blockquote>\n  <p><strong>Current Stable Version:</strong> 5.6.4 <em>// Release Date: 18 Dec 2014</em></p>\n  \n  <p><strong>Old Stable Version:</strong> 5.5.20 <em>// Release Date: 18 Dec 2014</em></p>\n  \n  <p><strong>Old Stable Version:</strong> 5.4.36 <em>// Release Date: 18 Dec 2014</em></p>\n</blockquote>\n\n<p>It is recommended to use the latest stable released version. Only this version contains all security and bug fixes. All versions lower than 5.4 are officially unsupported or <a href="http://php.net/archive/2014.php#id2014-08-14-1" rel="nofollow">announced</a> end-of-life.</p>\n\n<p>For further information about new features and required changes in a new version see the official migration docs:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://php.net/migration54" rel="nofollow">5.3.x-&gt;5.4.x</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://php.net/migration55" rel="nofollow">5.4.x-&gt;5.5.x</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://at1.php.net/manual/en/migration56.php" rel="nofollow">5.5.x-&gt;5.6.x</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>PHP 6</h3>\n\n<p>On <a href="https://wiki.php.net/rfc/php6" rel="nofollow">July, 30th, 2014 a majority of the PHP steering group decided to skip version 6</a> to avoid confusion with an earlier but abandoned PHP 6 project (dubbed the Unicode release). While there never was any official release of PHP 6, many books and articles had been published already.</p>\n\n<h2>Sample PHP script</h2>\n\n<p>This script displays <code>Hello World!</code> on your screen.</p>\n\n<pre><code>&lt;?php \n   echo \'Hello World!\';\n?&gt;\n</code></pre>\n\n<p>To run this script in a console, save it in current working directory in a file <code>hello.php</code> and simply execute command: <code>php hello.php</code>.</p>\n\n<h2>PHP Config information</h2>\n\n<p>This script displays config information</p>\n\n<pre><code>&lt;?php \n   phpinfo();\n?&gt;\n</code></pre>\n\n<p>Save the file in server(var/www) as <code>phpinfo.php</code> and run from browser. <code>localhost/phpinfo.php</code></p>\n\n<h2>Community</h2>\n\n<p>PHP has many active community forums, including:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://chat.stackoverflow.com/rooms/11/php">Stack Overflow PHP chat room</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.linuxfund.org/" rel="nofollow">Linux Fund</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://php.meetup.com" rel="nofollow">PHP Meetups</a></li>\n<li>freenode IRC channel <a href="https://gist.github.com/amalmurali47/6028653" rel="nofollow">#php</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h2>More information</h2>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Php" rel="nofollow">Wikipedia on PHP</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://php.net" rel="nofollow">PHP Official Page</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h2>Online documentation</h2>\n\n<p>The <a href="http://www.php.net/manual" rel="nofollow">PHP manual</a> is the official documentation for <a href="http://www.php.net/langref" rel="nofollow">the language syntax</a>, featuring function search and URL shortcuts (for example <a href="http://php.net/explode" rel="nofollow">http://php.net/explode</a>). <a href="http://www.php.net/funcref" rel="nofollow">The API is well documented</a> for native and additional extensions. Most additional extensions can be found in <a href="http://pecl.php.net/packages.php" rel="nofollow">PECL</a>. The <a href="http://pear.php.net/" rel="nofollow">PEAR</a> repository contains a plethora of community supplied classes. It is also possible to download a offline version of the documentation <a href="http://php.net/download-docs.php" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>\n\n<h3>PHP Tutorials</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://php.net/manual/en/tutorial.php" rel="nofollow">PHP Basics</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>PHP security related information</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://www.owasp.org/index.php/PHP_Security_Cheat_Sheet" rel="nofollow">PHP Security Cheat Sheet</a> [by <a href="https://www.owasp.org" rel="nofollow">OWASP]\n</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Free online tutorials</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.codecademy.com/tracks/php" rel="nofollow">PHP-Codecademy</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/user/phpacademy" rel="nofollow">phpacademy</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Free PHP Programming Books</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.techotopia.com/index.php/PHP_Essentials" rel="nofollow">PHP Essentials</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.tuxradar.com/practicalphp" rel="nofollow">Practical PHP Programming</a> (wiki containing O\'Reilly\'s <em>PHP In a Nutshell</em>)</li>\n<li><a href="http://symfony.com/doc/current/book/index.html" rel="nofollow">Symfony2</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.survivethedeepend.com/" rel="nofollow">Zend Framework: Survive the Deep End</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.phptherightway.com/" rel="nofollow">PHP: The Right Way</a> (<em>is a community-driven quick reference for PHP best practices and accepted coding standards</em>)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<h2>Best PHP Books 2012</h2>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/1449319262" rel="nofollow">Learning PHP, MySQL, and JavaScript: A Step-By-Step Guide to Creating Dynamic Websites (Animal Guide)</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/1430232498" rel="nofollow">PHP Solutions: Dynamic Web Design Made Easy</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0672329166" rel="nofollow">PHP and MySQL Web Development (4th Edition)</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/1890774561" rel="nofollow">Murach\'s PHP and MySQL (Murach: Training &amp; Reference)</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0321784073" rel="nofollow">PHP and MySQL for Dynamic Web Sites: Visual QuickPro Guide (4th Edition)</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h2>Bought PHP books</h2>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://leanpub.com/phpprojectguide" rel="nofollow">The PHP Project Guide</a> (Book from phpacadamey. This is book is constantly updated)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<h2>Database support</h2>\n\n<p>PHP supports a wide range of <a href="/questions/tagged/databases" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'databases\'" rel="tag">databases</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/refs.database" rel="nofollow">relational and non-relational alike</a>.</p>\n\n<p>PHP is often paired with the <a href="http://www.php.net/mysqli" rel="nofollow">MySQL</a> relational database. PHP also includes great database support for <a href="http://www.php.net/pgsql" rel="nofollow">PostgreSQL</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/sqlite3" rel="nofollow">SQLite</a>, <a href="http://www.microsoft.com/sqlserver/2005/en/us/PHP-Driver.aspx" rel="nofollow">Microsoft SQL Server</a> (<a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc296152(SQL.90).aspx" rel="nofollow">API reference</a>), <a href="http://www.php.net/oci8" rel="nofollow">Oracle</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/ibm-db2" rel="nofollow">IBM DB2 &amp; Cloudscape, Apache Derby</a> and even <a href="http://www.php.net/uodbc" rel="nofollow">ODBC</a>.  </p>\n\n<p>All modern versions of PHP include <a href="http://www.php.net/pdo" rel="nofollow">PDO</a>, a built-in <a href="http://www.php.net/intro.pdo" rel="nofollow">data-access abstraction library</a> with <a href="http://www.php.net/pdo.drivers" rel="nofollow">comprehensive connectivity options</a>.  More recently, PECL extensions have surfaced that offer "NoSQL" database support, including <a href="http://github.com/mjpearson/Pandra/tree/master/lib/thrift/ext/thrift_protocol/" rel="nofollow">Apache Thrift</a> (for <a href="http://cassandra.apache.org" rel="nofollow">Apache Cassandra</a>), <a href="http://www.php.net/mongo" rel="nofollow">MongoDB</a>, <a href="http://github.com/owlient/phpredis/" rel="nofollow">Redis</a>, and others.</p>\n\n<h2>SAPI support</h2>\n\n<p>Like many other applications, web servers provide APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) to extend their functionality via third-party extensions. An API provided by a web server is generally referred as a SAPI (Server API). By utilizing different SAPIs, PHP can work on many different web servers as a server-side scripting language. The list of web servers associated with supported SAPIs includes:</p>\n\n\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://httpd.apache.org/" rel="nofollow">Apache HTTP Server (versions 1.3.x, 2.x)</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.iis.net/" rel="nofollow">Microsoft IIS</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.acme.com/software/thttpd/" rel="nofollow">thttpd (tiny/turbo/throttling HTTP server)</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://caudium.net/space/start" rel="nofollow">Caudium</a> </li>\n<li><a href="http://www.aolserver.com/" rel="nofollow">AOLserver 3.1 or later</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/middleware/iplanetwebserver-098726.html" rel="nofollow">Netscape Enterprise Web Server, Sun Java System Webserver, SUN/Netscape Alliance/Oracle iPlanet Web Server</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.litespeedtech.com/products/litespeed-web-server/overview" rel="nofollow">LiteSpeed Web Server</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://pi3web.sourceforge.net/pi3web/" rel="nofollow">Pi3Web</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.roxen.com/products/cms/webserver/" rel="nofollow">Roxen WebServer</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.cp15.org/webjames/" rel="nofollow">WebJames HTTP server</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/TUX_web_server" rel="nofollow">TUX web-server</a></li>\n<li>Continuity</li>\n<li>Phttpd</li>\n<li>Embed (as of version 5.4.0 PHP provides built-in web server)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>PHP can be run on many other servers. For PHP to be run on a given web server, it is only required that a server implements one of the supported SAPIs. For example, Sambar web server can interact with PHP through the SAPI which is native to Microsoft IIS (internally called <em>isapi</em> in PHP). In addition, if specific web server SAPI is not supported, one of the generic interfaces, which are widely supported by web servers, can be used. These include:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>CGI (Common Gateway Interface)</li>\n<li>FastCGI</li>\n<li>FPM (FastCGI Process Manager)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>PHP is intended for developing server-side web applications, but stand-alone and client-side applications can be developed as well. To be consistent with its server-oriented architecture, PHP defines and implements CLI (Command Line Interface) SAPI for these applications.</p>\n\n<p>PHP can be also used as a Sendmail milter.</p>\n\n<h2>Useful Third-party Code and Tools</h2>\n\n<p>In addition to the vast functionality provided in the PHP Core and through PEAR and PECL, there are a number of noteworthy 3rd party contributions to the PHP world, some of which are listed below.</p>\n\n<h3>Package Management with Composer</h3>\n\n<p><a href="http://getcomposer.org/" rel="nofollow">Composer</a> is a package management tool for PHP that was inspired by npm for NodeJS and Bundler for Ruby.  It allows for per-project dependencies to be specified in a JSON file and easily loaded into the project.</p>\n\n<p>Composer uses packages from <a href="https://packagist.org/" rel="nofollow">Packagist</a>, which is rapidly growing to contain many of the most popular PHP libraries.</p>\n\n<p>Composer solves the following problems:</p>\n\n<ol>\n<li>You have a project that depends on a number of libraries.</li>\n<li>Some of those libraries depend on other libraries .</li>\n<li>You declare the things you depend on</li>\n<li>Composer finds out which versions of which packages need to be installed, and installs them (meaning it downloads them into your project).</li>\n</ol>\n\n<p><em>Nothing comes for free: used without deep understanding of what you include using Composer, you might include certain security problems as a side effect, e.g.</em></p>\n\n<h3>Frameworks</h3>\n\n<p>PHP has a variety of object-oriented web application frameworks that provide a lot of the common functionality required to build modern web application out of the box, with the more well-known being (in alphabetical order) the following ones:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.agavi.org/" rel="nofollow">Agavi</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://cakephp.org/" rel="nofollow">CakePHP</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://codeigniter.com/" rel="nofollow">CodeIgniter</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://flow3.typo3.org/" rel="nofollow">Flow3</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://fatfree.sourceforge.net" rel="nofollow">Fat-Free</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.fuelphp.com" rel="nofollow">FuelPHP</a>  (Kohana-alike HMVC Framework that comes along with ORM and Code Generator)</li>\n<li><a href="http://kohanaframework.org/" rel="nofollow">Kohana</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://laravel.com" rel="nofollow">Laravel</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://limonade-php.github.io" rel="nofollow">Limonade</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://li3.me/" rel="nofollow">Lithium</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://nette.org/en/" rel="nofollow">Nette</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://symfony.com/" rel="nofollow">Symfony</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.yiiframework.com/" rel="nofollow">Yii</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://framework.zend.com/" rel="nofollow">Zend Framework</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://incubator.apache.org/zetacomponents/" rel="nofollow">Zeta Components (formerly ezComponents)</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.xajax-project.org/" rel="nofollow">xAjax</a> (simplifies AJAX programming using PHP)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.phpwact.org/php/mvc_frameworks" rel="nofollow">more \u2026</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Content Management System</h3>\n\n<p>PHP provides lot of content management softwares which can be used by people who are unaware of coding too. some of them are open source while others are proprietary Softwares.<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_content_management_systems" rel="nofollow">List of Content management softwares</a></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.joomla.org/" rel="nofollow">Joomla</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/" rel="nofollow">Wordpress</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://www.drupal.org/" rel="nofollow">drupal</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.cmsmadesimple.org/" rel="nofollow">cms made simple</a></li>\n<li>and <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_content_management_systems" rel="nofollow">many more</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Object-Relational Mapping</h3>\n\n<p>Object relational maps try to solve or mitigate the <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Object-relational_impedance_mismatch" rel="nofollow">object-relational impedance mismatch</a> problem by transparently mapping between table structures in a database and business objects in an application. The more prominent ORMs in the PHP world are (in alphabetical order):</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.doctrine-project.org/" rel="nofollow">Doctrine</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://codehappy.daylerees.com/eloquent-orm" rel="nofollow">Eloquent</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.propelorm.org/" rel="nofollow">Propel</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Redbean_(software)" rel="nofollow">Redbean</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/List_of_object-relational_mapping_software#PHP" rel="nofollow">more \u2026</a></li>\n</ul>\n\nPopular questions and answers\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/108699/good-php-orm-library">Good PHP ORM Library?</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/search?tab=relevance&amp;q=%5Bphp%5D%20orm">more \u2026</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Quality Assurance Tools</h3>\n\n<p>In recent years, there have been a steady increase of quality assurance tools in the PHP world. As PHP moved into the professional mainstream, tools to assert certain quality features and <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Software_metric" rel="nofollow">metrics</a> were needed and provided by the PHP community. These tools include frameworks for <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Debugging" rel="nofollow">debugging</a>, <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Unit_testing" rel="nofollow">unit-testing</a>, <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Code_analysis" rel="nofollow">code analysis</a> and <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Code_coverage" rel="nofollow">coverage</a>, <a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/Continuous_integration" rel="nofollow">continuous integration</a> and other aspects of professional development, some of which are listed below:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.phpunit.de/" rel="nofollow">PHPUnit</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://pear.php.net/package/PHP_CodeSniffer/redirected" rel="nofollow">PEAR CodeSniffer</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://simpletest.org/" rel="nofollow">SimpleTest</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.xdebug.org/" rel="nofollow">XDebug</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://phpqatools.org/" rel="nofollow">more \u2026</a></li>\n</ul>\n\nPopular questions and answers\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/346620/what-are-unit-tests-and-why-should-i-care">What are unit tests and why should I care?</a> </li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/888/how-do-you-debug-php-scripts">How do you debug PHP scripts?</a> </li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/941537/recommended-server-for-continuous-integration-for-php-project">Recommended server for continuous integration for a PHP project</a> </li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>IDEs</h3>\n\n<p>An <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integrated_development_environment" rel="nofollow">Integrated Development Environment (IDE)</a> is software that provides most of the tools needed to produce other software in a convenient package. Standard features of IDEs are usually source code editors with syntax highlighting, code completion as well as debugging functionality, build assistance, version control system integration, etc. Some of the major known PHP IDEs are:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://www.eclipse.org/pdt/" rel="nofollow">Eclipse with PDT</a> (free)</li>\n<li><a href="http://netbeans.org/features/php/" rel="nofollow">NetBeans</a> (free)</li>\n<li><a href="http://aptana.org/" rel="nofollow">Aptana Studio</a> (free)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.jetbrains.com/phpstorm/" rel="nofollow">PHP Storm</a> (commercial)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.nusphere.com/products/phped.htm" rel="nofollow">PhpED</a> (commercial) </li>\n<li><a href="http://www.zend.com/products/studio/" rel="nofollow">Zend Studio</a> (commercial, Eclipse-based)</li>\n<li><a href="http://panic.com/coda/" rel="nofollow">Coda</a> (commercial, Mac users)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.sublimetext.com/" rel="nofollow">Sublime Text</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.activestate.com/komodo-ide" rel="nofollow">ActiveState Komodo IDE</a> (commercial, multi-platform)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.activestate.com/komodo-edit" rel="nofollow">ActiveState Komodo Edit</a> (free)</li>\n<li><a href="https://secure.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/wiki/List_of_PHP_editors" rel="nofollow">more \u2026</a> (includes editors as well)</li>\n</ul>\n\nPopular questions and answers\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/116292/what-is-the-best-ide-for-php">What is the best IDE for PHP?</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/search?q=php+IDE">more \u2026</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<hr>\n\n<h2>Frequently Asked Questions</h2>\n\n<p>Find some answers to some of the more frequently asked questions about PHP below.</p>\n\n<h3>I have a question about PHP 6</h3>\n\n<p>Note that all development on the PHP 6 branch has been canceled. Version 6 will be skipped. The next expected major release is PHP 7, which is currently in development. Please refrain from asking questions about PHP 6.</p>\n\n<h3> I have a typical "does not work" problem. What should I do before asking a question?</h3>\n\n<p>The causes of a typical "does not work" or "works on localhost but does not work on production server" problem can easily be diagnosed by setting the <a href="http://www.php.net/display_errors" rel="nofollow"><code>display_errors</code></a> value to <code>On</code> or <code>1</code>. </p>\n\n<p>An incorrectly configured development server and a typical production server has this setting turned off. This suppresses all error messages - something you should be looking for when trying to diagnose the problem.</p>\n\n<p>Before you post your question, find all error messages reported by PHP and see if you can fix them yourself. Errors such as "PHP Warning: \u2026" and "You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual \u2026" might be fairly simple to fix. Google the error message and search for it on Stack Overflow. Most error messages have well known solutions.  Additionally, many of the most commonly encountered error messages have been compiled into one reference. Look it over to see if your error is already addressed there. See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12769982/reference-what-does-this-error-mean-in-php">Reference: What does this error mean in PHP?</a></p>\n\n<p><code>display_errors</code> can be set to <code>On</code> via multiple ways. On your development machine you should set the value by editing php.ini file. On a production server, if it is not possible (or desirable) to edit this file, add these line at the beginning of the script:</p>\n\n<pre><code>error_reporting(-1); // to enable all errors\nini_set(\'display_errors\', 1);\nini_set(\'display_startup_errors\', 1);\n</code></pre>\n\n<p>Make sure to list any errors you cannot fix on your own in your question.</p>\n\n<p>Make sure you are not suppressing errors by using the <code>@</code> syntax. This is not good practice, particularly during development when you want to be advised of errors.</p>\n\n<p>From the <a href="http://www.php.net/manual/en/language.operators.errorcontrol.php" rel="nofollow">manual</a>:</p>\n\n<blockquote>\n  <p><strong>Warning!</strong><br>\n  Currently the "@" error-control operator prefix will even disable error reporting for critical errors that will terminate script execution. Among other things, this means that if you use "@" to suppress errors from a certain function and either it isn\'t available or has been mistyped, the script will die right there with no indication as to why.</p>\n</blockquote>\n\n<h3>How do I make my database queries secure from SQL injection?</h3>\n\n<p>In a nutshell, use proper escaping techniques using <em>prepared statements</em> and <em>placeholders</em>. Each database interface follows the same general pattern:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Prepare</strong> a SQL statement containing placeholders</li>\n<li><strong>Bind</strong> PHP variables to those placeholders</li>\n<li><strong>Execute</strong> the prepared statement</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>Some interfaces allow you to skip the bind step by providing the list of replacements for the placeholders during execute. For your reference:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>PDO</strong> <a href="http://www.php.net/pdo.prepare" rel="nofollow">prepare</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/pdostatement.bindparam" rel="nofollow">bind</a> (optional), <a href="http://www.php.net/pdostatement.execute" rel="nofollow">execute</a></li>\n<li><strong>MySQLi</strong> <a href="http://www.php.net/mysqli.prepare" rel="nofollow">prepare</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/mysqli-stmt.bind-param" rel="nofollow">bind</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/mysqli-stmt.execute" rel="nofollow">execute</a></li>\n<li><strong>PostgreSQL</strong> <a href="http://www.php.net/pg-prepare" rel="nofollow">prepare</a>, bind (none), <a href="http://www.php.net/pg-execute" rel="nofollow">execute</a></li>\n<li><strong>SQLite 3</strong> <a href="http://www.php.net/sqlite3.prepare" rel="nofollow">prepare</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/sqlite3stmt.bindparam" rel="nofollow">bind</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/sqlite3stmt.execute" rel="nofollow">execute</a></li>\n<li><strong>MS SQL Server (5.3+)</strong> <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc296181%28v=SQL.90%29.aspx" rel="nofollow">prepare and bind (combined)</a>, <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc296162%28v=SQL.90%29.aspx" rel="nofollow">execute</a></li>\n<li><strong>Oracle</strong> <a href="http://www.php.net/function.oci_parse" rel="nofollow">prepare</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/oci_bind_by_name" rel="nofollow">bind</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/oci_execute" rel="nofollow">execute</a></li>\n<li><strong>IBM DB2</strong> <a href="http://www.php.net/db2_prepare" rel="nofollow">prepare</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/function.db2_bind-param" rel="nofollow">bind</a>, <a href="http://www.php.net/db2_execute" rel="nofollow">execute</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<blockquote>\n  <p><strong>Notice:</strong> the old ext/mysql extension does not support prepared statements and is <a href="http://php.net/manual/en/mysqlinfo.api.choosing.php" rel="nofollow">deprecated</a> to use nowadays. Use <a href="http://www.php.net/pdo" rel="nofollow">PDO</a> or <a href="http://www.php.net/mysqli" rel="nofollow">MySqli</a> instead.</p>\n</blockquote>\n\nSee Also\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/60174/best-way-to-prevent-sql-injection-in-php">Best way to prevent SQL Injection in PHP</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://bobby-tables.com/php.html" rel="nofollow">http://bobby-tables.com/php.html</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>My special characters come out all screwed up. Why?</h3>\n\n<p>You need to learn about what character sets are and use encodings properly throughout your script. Some resources to get you started on the topic:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/279170/utf-8-all-the-way-through">UTF-8 all the way through</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://kore-nordmann.de/blog/php_charset_encoding_FAQ.html" rel="nofollow">PHP charset/encoding FAQ</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://kunststube.net/encoding/" rel="nofollow">What Every Programmer Absolutely, Positively Needs To Know About Encodings And Character Sets To Work With Text</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://kunststube.net/frontback/" rel="nofollow">Handling Unicode Front To Back In A Web App</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>"Headers have already been sent..."</h3>\n\n<p>You\'re outputting content and triggering PHP\'s default content-type:text/html header before making your own call to <code>header()</code>. There are a few ways this can happen, check for a stray <code>echo</code> or <code>print</code>, white space before and after the <code>&lt;?php</code> and <code>?&gt;</code> tags or maybe a Unicode BOM.  Consider using output buffering. With many scripts, there is no need to include the ending <code>?&gt;</code> and the problem is easily fixed by removing the ending <code>?&gt;</code> tag from your files. See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8028957/headers-already-sent-by-php">How to fix "Headers already sent" error in PHP</a>.</p>\n\n<h3>How do I make my E-Mails secure from <a href="http://www.phpsecure.info/v2/article/MailHeadersInject.en.php" rel="nofollow">E-Mail injection</a>?</h3>\n\n<p>Validate your input! In recent versions of PHP, <a href="http://php.net/mail" rel="nofollow">mail()</a> is no longer vulnerable to e-mail header injection through the subject line or receiver, as it removes all the control characters, but you may want to make sure the receivers\' list doesn\'t include multiple addresses if that\'s not what you desire.\nIf you allow the user to specify part of the body of the message, you must also validate or sanitize it so that he\'s unable to, e.g. add new MIME parts or end any prematurely. Therefore, for building MIME messages, you\'re strongly encouraged to use a library. See, for instance, <a href="http://pear.php.net/package/Mail_Mime" rel="nofollow">PEAR Mail_Mime</a>.</p>\n\n<h3>Can I protect my PHP code from theft? If so, how?</h3>\n\n<p>There is no <em>effective</em> technical solution to protect, encode or encrypt PHP source code.  There are many products that offer some levels of protection, like <a href="http://ioncube.com/" rel="nofollow">IonCube</a> (commercial) and <a href="http://www.zend.com/en/products/guard/" rel="nofollow">Zend Guard</a> (commercial), but <em>all</em> can be broken with time and effort. Your best option is not a technical solution, but a legal solution in the form of a license agreement.</p>\n\n<h3>How can strings be written in PHP?</h3>\n\n<p>There are <a href="http://php.net/language.types.string" rel="nofollow">four ways to write strings literals in PHP</a>. Each method is slightly different in terms of escape sequences and string interpolation. For instance, <code>\'\\n\'</code> is a literal two-character string with characters <code>\\</code> and <code>n</code>, while <code>"\\n"</code> is a one-character string with a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line_feed" rel="nofollow">LF</a> character. All of them produce values of type <code>string</code> (which is actually a byte array, as it completely encoding unaware).</p>\n\n<h3>When/why does the <code>mail()</code> function not work?</h3>\n\n<p>The <code>mail()</code> function depends on correct server configuration. See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24644436/php-mail-form-doesnt-complete-sending-e-mail">PHP mail form doesn\'t complete sending e-mail</a> for a list of common reasons. Then investigage <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/303783/phpmailer-vs-swiftmailer">PHPMailer/SwiftMailer</a> as alternative.</p>\n\n<h3>What does a specific Operator mean in PHP?</h3>\n\n<p>See this <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3737139/reference-what-does-this-symbol-mean-in-php">Community Wiki</a> for a helpful list.</p>\n\n<h3>How do I parse HTML/XML with PHP?</h3>\n\n<p>See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3577641/best-methods-to-parse-html">How do you parse and process HTML/XML in PHP?</a> and <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/188414/best-xml-parser-for-php/">Best XML Parser for PHP</a>.</p>\n\n<h3>How do I turn on error reporting to find the source of problems?</h3>\n\n<p>See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1824282/php-production-server-turn-on-error-messages">PHP production server - turn on error messages</a>. You typically need just <code>error_reporting(E_ALL);</code> at the top of your script, unless it\'s a parsing error there. As very crude method <code>set_error_handler("var_dump");</code> overrides all uncommon disable options. And in case of a HTTP 500 internal server error, or a completely blank page, you often want to look into the web servers <code>error.log</code> first.</p>\n\n<h3>How do I fix "eregi is deprecated" messages and switch to <code>preg_match()</code>?</h3>\n\n<p>See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6270004/converting-ereg-expressions-to-preg">How can I convert ereg expressions to preg in PHP?</a>.</p>\n\n<h3>Why does <code>mysqli_fetch_array()</code> or <code>mysqli_fetch_assoc()</code> return only one row?</h3>\n\n<p>Many RDBMS fetching functions must be called in a loop until the query result resource returns <code>FALSE</code>.  </p>\n\n<pre class="lang-php prettyprint-override"><code>// A common looping pattern, appending result rows onto the array $rowset\n$result = mysqli_query($link, "SELECT column1, column2 FROM table");\nif ($result) {\n  $rowset = array();\n  while ($row = mysqli_fetch_array($result)) {\n    // Append the current row onto $rowset\n    $rowset[] = $row;\n  }\n}\nelse {\n  echo mysqli_error($link);\n}\n</code></pre>\n\n<h3>Can I fill class properties with <code>new object()</code> calls or function calls?</h3>\n\n<p>No. See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9159202/instance-as-a-static-class-property">Instance as a static class property</a>; see <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/q/3960323">Why don\'t PHP attributes allow functions?</a> for an attempt at an explanation.</p>\n\n<h3>How do I fix the error <code>mysqli_fetch_array()</code> or <code>mysqli_fetch_assoc() expects parameter 1 to be resource, boolean given</code>?</h3>\n\n<p>This is caused by a failed query, which is typically indicative of a syntax error in the SQL statement. Another common cause is using a <a href="http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/reserved-words.html" rel="nofollow">MySQL reserved keyword</a>  as a table or column name without surrounding it with backticks. For example: </p>\n\n<pre><code>$query = \'SELECT order FROM my_table\'; // This will fail\n$query = \'SELECT `order` FROM my_table\'; //This will work\n</code></pre>\n\n<p>Use <code>echo mysqli_error($link)</code> to view the error message that was generated by MySQL.</p>\n\n<h3>How do I validate an email address?</h3>\n\n<p>See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12026842/how-to-validate-an-emailaddress-in-php/12026863">How to validate an email address in PHP</a>. As of PHP 5.2 you can simply use the <code>filter_var()</code> function with the <code>FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL</code> filter.</p>\n\n<h3>Why does my assigned session-variable not appear in the next script?</h3>\n\n<p>Session-variable require a session to be started. Please review the manual-page of <a href="http://www.php.net/manual/en/function.session-start.php" rel="nofollow">session_start()</a>.</p>\n\n<p>Additionally, cookies need to be enabled, as explained on <a href="http://support.google.com/accounts/bin/answer.py?hl=en&amp;answer=61416" rel="nofollow">this Google page</a>. </p>\n\n<h3>What does my error message mean:</h3>\n\n<p>Many of the most commonly encountered error messages in PHP have been compiled into one reference.</p>\n\n<p>See Reference: <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12769982/reference-what-does-this-error-mean-in-php">What does this error mean in PHP?</a></p>\n\n<h3>How do I sort arrays?</h3>\n\n<p>You wouldn\'t believe how often this question comes up. So we made a reference for it:</p>\n\n<p><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/q/17364127/476">Reference: all basic ways to sort arrays in PHP</a></p>\n\n<h2>Reference</h2>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://php.net/manual/en/index.php" rel="nofollow">Php Manual</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PHP" rel="nofollow">Php wikipedia page</a></li>\n</ul>',

2015-01-03 09:40:30+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Scraped from <200 http://stackoverflow.com/tags/c/info>
	{'descr': u'<div class="welovestackoverflow" id="wiki-excerpt" style="display:none">\r\n                <p>C is a general-purpose computer programming language used for operating systems, libraries, games and other high performance work and is clearly distinct from C++. It was developed in 1972 by Dennis Ritchie for use with the Unix operating system.</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_%28programming_language%29" rel="nofollow">C</a> (pronounced <em>"See"</em>, like the letter C) is a general-purpose computer programming language developed between 1969 and 1973 by <a href="http://cm.bell-labs.com/who/dmr/" rel="nofollow">Dennis Ritchie</a> at the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bell_Labs" rel="nofollow">Bell Telephone Laboratories</a> for use with the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UNIX" rel="nofollow">UNIX operating system</a>. Its design provides constructs that map efficiently to typical machine instructions, and therefore it found lasting use in applications that had formerly been coded in assembly language. It is a highly efficient procedural oriented programming language, has emphasis on functions whereas modern object oriented programming languages tend to emphasize data.</p>\n\n<p>Although C was designed for implementing system software, it is also widely used for developing portable application software.</p>\n\n<p>C is one of the most widely used programming languages of all time and there are very few computer architectures for which a C compiler does not exist. C has greatly influenced many other popular programming languages, most notably <a href="/questions/tagged/c%2b%2b" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'c++\'" rel="tag">c++</a>, which began as an extension to C.</p>\n\n<h2>Design</h2>\n\n<p>C is an imperative (<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procedural_programming" rel="nofollow">procedural</a>) systems implementation language. It was designed to be compiled using a relatively straightforward compiler, to provide low-level access to memory, to provide language constructs that map efficiently to machine instructions, and to require minimal run-time support. C was therefore useful for many applications that had formerly been coded in assembly language.</p>\n\n<p>Despite its low-level capabilities, the language was designed to encourage cross-platform programming. A standards-compliant and portably written C program can be compiled for a very wide variety of computer platforms and operating systems with few changes to its source code. The language has become available on a very wide range of platforms, from embedded micro-controllers to supercomputers.</p>\n\n<h2>Before you start</h2>\n\n<p>Please browse <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/tags/c/faq">our list of frequently asked questions</a> and the following list to see if your question is similar to one of the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/119123/why-isnt-sizeof-for-a-struct-equal-to-the-sum-of-sizeof-of-each-member">Why isn\u2019t sizeof for a struct equal to the sum of sizeof of each member?</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/98650/what-is-the-strict-aliasing-rule">What is the strict aliasing rule?</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/141525/absolute-beginners-guide-to-bit-shifting">Absolute Beginner\u2019s Guide to Bit Shifting</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4121090/why-undefined-reference-even-for-declared-variables">Why does the linker fail with undefined symbols?</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4051/passing-multidimensional-arrays-as-function-arguments-in-c">Passing multi-dimensional arrays as function arguments</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/81656/where-do-i-find-the-current-c-or-c-standard-documents">Where can I find the C or C++ standard documents?</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8547778/why-is-one-loop-so-much-slower-than-two-loops">Why is one loop so much slower than two loops?</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/47981/how-do-you-set-clear-and-toggle-a-single-bit-in-c-c">How do you set, clear and toggle a single bit in C/C++?</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>If you haven\'t found an answer to your question after searching, or in the list above, we\'re here to help!</p>\n\n<p>When posting questions about C programming, please make sure to include:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>OS &amp; compiler version</li>\n<li>Relevant flags / switches passed to the compiler, assembler or linker if applicable</li>\n<li>Verbatim copies of compiler warnings or errors if applicable</li>\n<li>Snippets of source code identified as problematic by the compiler if applicable</li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Is it C, C++ or both?</h3>\n\n<p>This tag is for questions related to C, not <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/c++">C++</a>. In some cases, you may be working with both and applying both tags is entirely appropriate. However, please refrain from using both tags in an effort to help your question reach a wider audience. After all, C++ answers <em>won\'t</em> help you solve the problem in C, and good C answers often do not describe the best approach in C++.</p>\n\n<h3>Important notes that may save you time</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://c-faq.com/" rel="nofollow">The comp.lang.c FAQ</a> has answers to many frequently asked C questions.  For example, see <a href="http://c-faq.com/decl/spiral.anderson.html" rel="nofollow">The Clockwise/Spiral Rule</a> for parsing C declarations.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Hello World program in C:</h3>\n\n<pre class="lang-c prettyprint-override"><code>#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;\n#include &lt;stdlib.h&gt;\n\nint main(void)\n{\n    printf("Hello World");\n    return EXIT_SUCCESS;\n}\n</code></pre>\n\n<h3>Hello World using user-defined function in C:</h3>\n\n<pre class="lang-c prettyprint-override"><code>#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;\n#include &lt;stdlib.h&gt;\n\nvoid helloWorld(void)\n{\n    printf("Hello World!");\n}\n\nint main(void)\n{\n    helloWorld();\n    return EXIT_SUCCESS;\n}\n</code></pre>\n\n<h2>Definitive Book Guide</h2>\n\n<p>The following list of books has been compiled by <a href="/questions/tagged/c" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'c\'" rel="tag">c</a> users as a definitive list of quality references for all levels of C programmer. Steele</li>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0596004362" rel="nofollow">C Pocket Reference (O\'Reilly)</a> - Peter Prinz, Ulla Kirch-Prinz</li>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0201179288" rel="nofollow">C - Traps and Pitfalls</a> - Andrew R. Koenig (Bell Labs)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><strong>Beginner</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0672326663" rel="nofollow">Programming in C (3rd Edition)</a> - Stephen Kochan</li>\n<li><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0672326965" rel="nofollow">C Primer Plus</a> - Stephen Prata</li>\n<li><a href="http://knking.com/books/c2/index.html" rel="nofollow">C Programming: A Modern Approach</a> - K. To make programming faster, Spark provides clean, concise APIs in Scala, Java and Python. You can also use Spark interactively from the Scala and Python shells to rapidly query big datasets.</p>',

The provider may have the data stored or may be relaying it from a live source.</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p>In computer science, streaming is the process of sending or receiving a sequence (stream) of data elements made available over time. A stream can be thought of as a conveyor belt that allows items to be processed one at a time rather than in large batches which must be completed in whole before subsequent data transfer occurs.</p>\n\n<p>Streams are processed differently from batch data \u2013 normal functions cannot operate on streams as a whole, as they have potentially unlimited data, streams are codata (potentially unlimited), not data (which is finite). </p>',

2015-01-03 09:40:32+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Crawled (200) <GET http://stackoverflow.com/tags/html5/info> (referer: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/11432599/live-streaming-to-android-using-4-1-html-5)
2015-01-03 09:40:32+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Scraped from <200 http://stackoverflow.com/tags/html5/info>
	{'descr': u'<div class="welovestackoverflow" id="wiki-excerpt" style="display:none">\r\n                <p>HTML5 (Hyper Text Markup Language, version 5) is an umbrella term for recent web technologies. It is also the latest iteration of HTML Became a W3C Recommendation in October 2014, introducing new elements and APIs.</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p>HTML5 is a core technology <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markup_language" rel="nofollow">markup language</a> of the Internet used for structuring and presenting content for the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web" rel="nofollow">World Wide Web</a>. As of <strong>28 October 2014</strong> this is the final and complete fifth revision of the HTML standard of the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web_Consortium" rel="nofollow">World Wide Web Consortium</a> (W3C).<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Wide_Web_Consortium" rel="nofollow">3</a> The previous version, HTML 4, was standardised in 1997.</p>\n\n<p>On 18 January 2011, the W3C introduced a <a href="http://www.w3.org/html/logo/downloads/HTML5_Logo.svg" rel="nofollow">logo</a> to <a href="http://www.w3.org/html/logo/faq.html" rel="nofollow">represent</a> the use of or interest in HTML5. Unlike other badges previously issued by the W3C, it does not imply validity or conformance to a certain standard. As of 1 April 2011, this logo is official.</p>\n\n<blockquote>\n  <p><strong>Note:</strong> <em>"The term "HTML5" is widely used as a buzzword to refer to modern Web technologies, many of which (though by no means all) are developed at the WHATWG, in some cases in conjunction with the W3C and IETF."</em> (WHATWG <a href="http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/introduction.html#is-this-html5?" rel="nofollow">Is this HTML5?</a>)</p>\n</blockquote>\n\n<p>Compared to its predecessors (HTML 4.1 and XHTML 1.0) HTML5 introduces new elements and also some JavaScript features, including:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>&lt;<a href="http://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/#the-video-element" rel="nofollow">video</a>&gt; and &lt;<a href="http://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/#the-audio-element" rel="nofollow">audio</a>&gt; elements for native media playback</li>\n<li>&lt;<a href="http://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/#canvas" rel="nofollow">canvas</a>&gt; element for procedural drawing</li>\n<li>new form elements</li>\n<li>new input types and attributes</li>\n<li>new semantic structural elements like &lt;<a href="http://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/#the-header-element" rel="nofollow">header</a>&gt;, &lt;<a href="http://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/#the-footer-element" rel="nofollow">footer</a>&gt;, &lt;<a href="http://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/#the-nav-element" rel="nofollow">nav</a>&gt;, &lt;<a href="http://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/#the-section-element" rel="nofollow">section</a>&gt;, and &lt;<a href="http://dev.w3.org/html5/html-author/#the-article-element" rel="nofollow">article</a>&gt;</li>\n<li>Drag and Drop feature</li>\n<li>local storage APIs</li>\n<li>an offline web applications API</li>\n<li>Device APIs such as Camera API, Location API etc</li>\n<li>3D, Graphics &amp; Effects</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>The <a href="http://www.w3.org/2012/12/html5-cr.html.en" rel="nofollow">HTML5 Definition has been declared complete in December 2012</a> (together with Canvas 2D), and the next round of W3C HTML standardization is now available as the <a href="http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/Overview.html" rel="nofollow">draft of HTML5.1</a>. </p>\n\n<hr>\n\n<p>Related Tags:\n<a href="/questions/tagged/html5-canvas" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'html5-canvas\'" rel="tag">html5-canvas</a>, <a href="/questions/tagged/html5-video" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'html5-video\'" rel="tag">html5-video</a>, <a href="/questions/tagged/html5-audio" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'html5-audio\'" rel="tag">html5-audio</a>, <a href="/questions/tagged/html5-animation" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'html5-animation\'" rel="tag">html5-animation</a></p>\n\n<hr>\n\n<h1>HTML5 <code>&lt;video&gt;</code> Element</h1>\n\n<p>The <code>&lt;video&gt;</code> element specifies video, such as a movie clip or other video streams.</p>\n\n<p>Currently, there are 3 supported video formats for the <code>&lt;video&gt;</code> element: MP4, WebM, and Ogg:</p>\n\n<p>The <code>&lt;video&gt;</code> element is supported in Internet Explorer 9+, Firefox, Opera, Chrome, and Safari.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> <em>Internet Explorer 8 and earlier versions, do not support the  element.</em></p>\n\n<hr>\n\n<h1>HTML5 <code>&lt;audio&gt;</code> Element</h1>\n\n<p>The <code>&lt;audio&gt;</code> element defines sound, such as music or other audio streams.</p>\n\n<p>Currently, there are 3 supported file formats for the <code>&lt;audio&gt;</code> element: MP3, Wav, and Ogg:</p>\n\n<p>The <code>&lt;audio&gt;</code> element is supported in Internet Explorer 9+, Firefox, Opera, Chrome, and Safari.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> Internet Explorer 8 and earlier versions, do not support the <code>&lt;audio&gt;</code> element.\nThe <code>&lt;video&gt;</code> element is supported in Internet Explorer 9+, Firefox, Opera, Chrome, and Safari.</p>\n\n<hr>\n\n<h1>HTML5 <code>&lt;canvas&gt;</code> Element</h1>\n\n<p>The HTML5 <code>&lt;canvas&gt;</code> element is used to draw graphics, on the fly, via scripting (usually JavaScript).</p>\n\n<p>The <code>&lt;canvas&gt;</code> element is only a container for graphics. You must use a script to actually draw the graphics.</p>\n\n<p>Canvas has several methods for drawing paths, boxes, circles, text, and adding images.</p>\n\n<p>Internet Explorer 9+, Firefox, Opera, Chrome, and Safari support the <code>&lt;canvas&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> Internet Explorer 8 and earlier versions, do not support the <code>&lt;canvas&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<hr>\n\n<h1>HTML5 New Form Elements</h1>\n\n<p>HTML5 has the following new form elements:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><code>&lt;datalist&gt;</code></li>\n<li><code>&lt;keygen&gt;</code></li>\n<li><code>&lt;output&gt;</code></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> Not all major browsers support all the new form elements. However, you can already start using them; If they are not supported, they will behave as regular text fields.</p>\n\n<h2>HTML5  <code>&lt;datalist&gt;</code> Element:</h2>\n\n<p>The <code>&lt;datalist&gt;</code> element specifies a list of pre-defined options for an <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p>The <code>&lt;datalist&gt;</code> element is used to provide an "autocomplete" feature on <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> elements. Users will see a drop-down list of pre-defined options as they input data.</p>\n\n<p>Use the <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element\'s list attribute to bind it together with a <code>&lt;datalist&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<h2>HTML5 <code>&lt;keygen&gt;</code> Element:</h2>\n\n<p>The purpose of the <code>&lt;keygen&gt;</code> element is to provide a secure way to authenticate users.</p>\n\n<p>The <code>&lt;keygen&gt;</code> element specifies a key-pair generator field in a form.</p>\n\n<p>When the form is submitted, two keys are generated, one private and one public.</p>\n\n<p>The private key is stored locally, and the public key is sent to the server. The public key could be used to generate a client certificate to authenticate the user in the future.</p>\n\n<h2>HTML5 <code>&lt;output&gt;</code> Element:</h2>\n\n<p>The  <code>&lt;output&gt;</code> element represents the result of a calculation (like one performed by a script).</p>\n\n<hr>\n\n<h1>HTML5 New Form Attributes</h1>\n\n<p>HTML5 has several new attributes for <code>&lt;form&gt;</code> and <code>&lt;input&gt;</code>.</p>\n\n<p><strong>New attributes for <code>&lt;form&gt;</code>:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>autocomplete</li>\n<li>novalidate</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><strong>New attributes for <code>&lt;input&gt;</code>:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>autocomplete</li>\n<li>autofocus</li>\n<li>form</li>\n<li>formaction</li>\n<li>formenctype</li>\n<li>formmethod</li>\n<li>formnovalidate</li>\n<li>formtarget</li>\n<li>height and width</li>\n<li>list</li>\n<li>min and max</li>\n<li>multiple</li>\n<li>pattern (regexp)</li>\n<li>placeholder</li>\n<li>required</li>\n<li>step</li>\n</ul>\n\n<h2>1. autocomplete Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The autocomplete attribute specifies whether a form or input field should have autocomplete on or off.</p>\n\n<p>When autocomplete is on, the browser automatically complete values based on values that the user has entered before.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Tip:</strong> It is possible to have autocomplete "on" for the form, and "off" for specific input fields, or vice versa.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The autocomplete attribute works with  and the following  types: text, search, url, tel, email, password, datepickers, range, and color.</p>\n\n<h2>2. novalidate Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The novalidate attribute is a boolean attribute.</p>\n\n<p>When present, it specifies that the form-data (input) should not be validated when submitted.</p>\n\n<h2>3. autofocus Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The autofocus attribute is a boolean attribute.</p>\n\n<p>When present, it specifies that an <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element should automatically get focus when the page loads.</p>\n\n<h2>4. form Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The form attribute specifies one or more forms an <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element belongs to.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Tip:</strong> To refer to more than one form, use a space-separated list of form ids.</p>\n\n<h2>5. formaction Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The formaction attribute specifies the URL of a file that will process the input control when the form is submitted.</p>\n\n<p>The formaction attribute overrides the action attribute of the <code>&lt;form&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The formaction attribute is used with type="submit" and type="image".</p>\n\n<h2>6. formenctype Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The formenctype attribute specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server (only for forms with method="post")</p>\n\n<p>The formenctype attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the <code>&lt;form&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The formenctype attribute is used with type="submit" and type="image".</p>\n\n<h2>7. formmethod Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The formmethod attribute defines the HTTP method for sending form-data to the action URL.</p>\n\n<p>The formmethod attribute overrides the method attribute of the <code>&lt;form&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The formmethod attribute can be used with type="submit" and type="image".</p>\n\n<h2>8. formnovalidate Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The novalidate attribute is a boolean attribute.</p>\n\n<p>When present, it specifies that the <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element should not be validated when submitted.</p>\n\n<p>The formnovalidate attribute overrides the novalidate attribute of the <code>&lt;form&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The formnovalidate attribute can be used with type="submit".</p>\n\n<h2>9. formtarget Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The formtarget attribute specifies a name or a keyword that indicates where to display the response that is received after submitting the form.</p>\n\n<p>The formtarget attribute overrides the target attribute of the <code>&lt;form&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The formtarget attribute can be used with type="submit" and type="image".</p>\n\n<h2>10. height and width Attributes</h2>\n\n<p>The height and width attributes specify the height and width of an <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The height and width attributes are only used with <code>&lt;input type="image"&gt;</code>.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Tip:</strong> Always specify both the height and width attributes for images. If height and width are set, the space required for the image is reserved when the page is loaded. However, without these attributes, the browser does not know the size of the image, and cannot reserve the appropriate space to it. The effect will be that the page layout will change during loading (while the images load).</p>\n\n<h2>11. list Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The list attribute refers to a <code>&lt;datalist&gt;</code> element that contains pre-defined options for an <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<h2>12. min and max Attributes</h2>\n\n<p>The min and max attributes specify the minimum and maximum value for an <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The min and max attributes works with the following input types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.</p>\n\n<h2>13. multiple Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The multiple attribute is a boolean attribute.</p>\n\n<p>When present, it specifies that the user is allowed to enter more than one value in the <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The multiple attribute works with the following input types: email, and file.</p>\n\n<h2>14. pattern Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The pattern attribute specifies a regular expression that the <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element\'s value is checked against.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The pattern attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, tel, email, and password.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Tip:</strong> Use the global title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user.</p>\n\n<h2>15. placeholder Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The placeholder attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field (<em>e.g. a sample value or a short description of the expected format</em>).</p>\n\n<p>The hint is displayed in the input field when it is empty, and disappears when the field gets focus.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The placeholder attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, tel, email, and password.</p>\n\n<h2>16. required Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The required attribute is a boolean attribute.</p>\n\n<p>When present, it specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The required attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, tel, email, password, date pickers, number, checkbox, radio, and file.</p>\n\n<h2>17. step Attribute</h2>\n\n<p>The step attribute specifies the legal number intervals for an <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Example:</strong> if step="3", legal numbers could be -3, 0, 3, 6, etc.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Tip:</strong> The step attribute can be used together with the max and min attributes to create a range of legal values.</p>\n\n<p><strong>Note:</strong> The step attribute works with the following input types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.</p>\n\n<hr>\n\n<p>There are several HTML5 introduction sites like <a href="http://diveintohtml5.info/" rel="nofollow">Dive into HTML5</a> or <a href="http://www.html5rocks.com" rel="nofollow">HTML5 Rocks</a>.  </p>\n\n<p>Each feature has varying levels of support in different web browsers.  <a href="http://caniuse.com/" rel="nofollow">CanIUse.com</a> and <a href="http://html5test.com/" rel="nofollow">HTML5Test</a> has great cross-browser compatibility information.</p>\n\n<p>HTML5 includes the previous standards; therefore, it is backwards compatible with existing content. However, deprecated elements are now classified as obsolete.</p>\n\n<p>The <a href="/questions/tagged/w3c" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'w3c\'" rel="tag">w3c</a> has released the specification for HTML5 <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>\n\n<p>The WHATWG actively works on HTML5 in what it terms the <a href="http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/introduction.html#history0" rel="nofollow">HTML Living Standard</a> and the two paths have diverged somewhat.</p>\n\n<h2>Resources</h2>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/HTML/HTML5" rel="nofollow">Mozilla MDN</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/?page=1" rel="nofollow">html5rocks</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.w3schools.com/html/html5_intro.asp" rel="nofollow">HTML5 Introduction</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Html5" rel="nofollow">HTML5 Wikipedia Article</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/" rel="nofollow">W3C HTML5 Documentation</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.w3.org/html/logo/faq.html" rel="nofollow">HTML5 Logo FAQ</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h2>Books</h2>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://diveintohtml5.info/" rel="nofollow">Dive into HTML5</a></li>\n</ul>',
	 'name': 'html5',

When using this tag, please include additional tags to clarify which specific environment/language/scenario your question refers to.</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_extraction" rel="nofollow">Data extraction</a> is a term with many different but related meanings, including:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Parsing files (such as HTML pages) or file metadata in order to obtain certain information. This often involves <a href="/questions/tagged/regular-expressions" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'regular-expressions\'" rel="tag">regular-expressions</a></p></li>\n<li><p>Retrieving single frames from audio, video or image files</p></li>\n<li><p>Breaking up functionality in a single source code unit (e.g. a function) into multiple units: <a href="/questions/tagged/refactoring" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'refactoring\'" rel="tag">refactoring</a></p></li>\n<li><p>Retrieving the original files from a (optionally compressed) archive file, such as a <code>.zip</code> or <code>.tar</code> file.</p></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><a href="/questions/tagged/extraction" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'extraction\'" rel="tag">extraction</a> should be added as a synonym for this tag.</p>',

2015-01-03 09:40:33+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Crawled (200) <GET http://stackoverflow.com/tags/apache/info> (referer: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27749746/how-to-convert-hex-to-integer-in-spark-in-an-rdd-modified)
2015-01-03 09:40:33+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Scraped from <200 http://stackoverflow.com/tags/apache/info>
	{'descr': u'<div class="welovestackoverflow" id="wiki-excerpt" style="display:none">\r\n                <p>The Apache HTTP Server, commonly referred to as Apache, is an open-source HTTP server for modern operating systems including UNIX, its variants and Windows. Apache is a secure, efficient and extensible server that provides HTTP services in sync with the current HTTP standards.</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p><strong><a href="https://www.apache.org/" rel="nofollow">The Apache HTTP Server</a></strong>, commonly referred to as Apache, is web server software notable for playing a key role in the initial growth of the World Wide Web. In 2009 it became the first web server software to surpass the 100 million website milestone. Apache was the first viable alternative to the Netscape Communications Corporation web server (currently named Oracle iPlanet Web Server), and since has evolved to rival other web servers in terms of functionality and performance. Typically Apache is run on a Unix-like operating system.</p>\n\n<p>Apache is developed and maintained by an open community of developers under the auspices of the Apache Software Foundation. The application is available for a wide variety of operating systems, including <a href="/questions/tagged/unix" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'unix\'" rel="tag">unix</a>, <a href="/questions/tagged/freebsd" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'freebsd\'" rel="tag">freebsd</a>, <a href="/questions/tagged/linux" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'linux\'" rel="tag">linux</a>, <a href="/questions/tagged/solaris" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'solaris\'" rel="tag">solaris</a>, Novell NetWare, <a href="/questions/tagged/amigaos" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'amigaos\'" rel="tag">amigaos</a>, <a href="/questions/tagged/macosx" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'macosx\'" rel="tag">macosx</a>, Microsoft Windows, OS/2, TPF, and eComStation. Released under the Apache License, Apache is open-source software.</p>\n\n<p>Apache was originally based on NCSA HTTPd code. The NCSA code has since been removed from Apache, due to a rewrite.</p>\n\n<p>Since April 1996 Apache has been the most popular HTTP server software in use. As of January 2012 Apache was estimated to serve 58% of all active websites and 65% of the top servers across all domains.</p>\n\n<p>Apache web server can be quickly and easily installed for development tasks, especially those related to <a href="/questions/tagged/php" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'php\'" rel="tag">php</a>, <a href="/questions/tagged/perl" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'perl\'" rel="tag">perl</a> and <a href="/questions/tagged/mysql" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'mysql\'" rel="tag">mysql</a>, using some packages such as <a href="/questions/tagged/xampp" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'xampp\'" rel="tag">xampp</a>.</p>\n\n<blockquote>\n  <p><strong>Latest major release:</strong> Apache 2.4 (<a href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/new_features_2_4.html" rel="nofollow">what\'s new?</a>)</p>\n</blockquote>\n\n<h2>References</h2>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://httpd.apache.org" rel="nofollow">The Apache Official Web site</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://httpd.apache.org/docs/" rel="nofollow">The Official documentation of the Apache Web Server</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apache_Software_Foundation" rel="nofollow">Apache Software Foundation Wikipedia Article</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apache_HTTP_Server" rel="nofollow">Apache HTTP Server Wikipedia Article</a></li>\n</ul>',
	 'name': 'apache',
	 'qcount': 47022,
	 'url': 'http://stackoverflow.com/tags/apache/info'}

2015-01-03 09:40:33+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Scraped from <200 http://stackoverflow.com/tags/awk/info>
	{'descr': u'<div class="welovestackoverflow" id="wiki-excerpt" style="display:none">\r\n                <p>AWK is an interpreted programming language designed for text processing and typically used as a data extraction and reporting tool.</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<blockquote>\n  <p><code>AWK</code> is an interpreted programming language designed for text processing and typically used as a data extraction and reporting tool. It is a standard feature of most Unix-like operating systems.</p>\n</blockquote>\n\n<p>Source: <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AWK" rel="nofollow">wikipedia</a>.</p>\n\n<p>Awk was originally developed by Alfred Aho, Brian Kernighan and Peter Weinberger in 1977 and updated in 1985.</p>\n\n<p>When asking questions about data processing using awk, please include complete input and desired output.</p>\n\n<h3>Some frequently occurring themes:</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/314384/parse-csv-file-using-gawk">Parsing CSV with awk</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2222150/extraction-of-data-from-a-simple-xml-file">Processing HTML/XML with awk</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3528659/shell-variable-interpreted-wrongly-in-awk">Using shell variables in awk</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Books:</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://cm.bell-labs.com/cm/cs/awkbook/" rel="nofollow">The AWK Programming Language</a> by Aho, Kernighan &amp; Weinberger</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.oreilly.com/catalog/awkprog3" rel="nofollow">Effective AWK, 3rd edition</a> by Robbins (see \'The GNU AWK Users Guide\' below)</li>\n<li><a href="http://www.oreilly.com/catalog/sed2" rel="nofollow">Sed &amp; Awk, 2nd edition</a> by Dougherty &amp; Robbins </li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Resources:</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="http://awk.info" rel="nofollow">Awk.Info</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.gnu.org/software/gawk/manual/" rel="nofollow">The GNU Awk User\'s Guide</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://www.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/utilities/awk.html" rel="nofollow">POSIX specification of awk</a></li>\n<li><a href="http://backreference.org/2010/02/10/idiomatic-awk/" rel="nofollow">Idiomatic awk</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<h3>Related tags:</h3>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="/questions/tagged/gawk" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'gawk\'" rel="tag">gawk</a> (GNU\'s version of awk)</li>\n<li><a href="/questions/tagged/nawk" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'nawk\'" rel="tag">nawk</a> (A newer improved version also from AT&amp;T)</li>\n<li><a href="/questions/tagged/mawk" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'mawk\'" rel="tag">mawk</a> (A different interpreter written by Mike Brennan)</li>\n<li><a href="/questions/tagged/sed" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'sed\'" rel="tag">sed</a> (A kindred tool often mentioned in the same breath)</li>\n</ul>',

	{'descr': u'<div class="welovestackoverflow" id="wiki-excerpt" style="display:none">\r\n                <p>Android is Google\'s OS for digital devices [Phone, Tablet, Auto, TV, Watch, Glass]. Please use Android-specific tags such as android-intent, not intent. For non-developer/programming questions, use http://android.stackexchange.com</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p><a href="http://www.android.com" rel="nofollow">Android</a> is an open-source operating system based on the Linux kernel. It was designed primarily for touchscreen devices like smartphones and tablets, but its use has more recently expanded to wearable devices such as Google Glass &amp; Android Wear (<a href="/questions/tagged/google-glass" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'google-glass\'" rel="tag"><img src="http://i.stack.imgur.com/KV8LZ.png" height="16" width="18" alt="" class="sponsor-tag-img">google-glass</a> and <a href="/questions/tagged/android-wear" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'android-wear\'" rel="tag">android-wear</a> respectively). Initially it was developed by Android Inc. and in 2005 it was taken over by Google. Android was unveiled in 2007 along with the founding of the <a href="http://www.openhandsetalliance.com" rel="nofollow">Open Handset Alliance</a>.</p>\n\n<h2>Tag Usage</h2>\n\n<p>When asking about a "force close" or "unfortunately app has stopped" problem in your app, always include the exception stack trace from logcat in the question. </p>\n\n<p>When adding additional tags to questions, please use the Android-specific tags such as <a href="/questions/tagged/android-intent" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'android-intent\'" rel="tag">android-intent</a> and <a href="/questions/tagged/android-activity" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'android-activity\'" rel="tag">android-activity</a>, not <a href="/questions/tagged/intent" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'intent\'" rel="tag">intent</a> and <a href="/questions/tagged/activity" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'activity\'" rel="tag">activity</a>.</p>\n\n<p>For 	{'descr': u'<div class="welovestackoverflow" id="wiki-excerpt" style="display:none">\r\n                <p>Google App Engine is a cloud computing technology for hosting web applications in Google-managed data centers. Google App Engine is a Platform as a Service (PaaS) offering for Java, Python, Go (experimental) and PHP (beta).\r\n</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p><strong><a href="https://developers.google.com/appengine/" rel="nofollow">Google App Engine</a></strong> is a cloud computing technology for hosting web applications in Google-managed data centers.</p>\n\n<p>Google App Engine lets you run your web applications on Google\'s infrastructure; \napplications are easy to build, easy to maintain, and easy to scale as your traffic and data storage needs grow:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Zero to sixty</strong>: Scale your app automatically without worrying about managing machines.</li>\n<li><strong>Supercharged APIs</strong>: Supercharge your app with services such as Task Queue, XMPP, and Cloud SQL, all powered by the same infrastructure that powers the Google services you use every day.</li>\n<li><strong>You\'re in control</strong>: Manage your application with a simple, web-based dashboard allowing you to customize your app\'s performance.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>With App Engine, there are no servers to maintain: You just upload your application, and it\'s ready to serve your users.</p>\n\n<p>Google App Engine makes it easy to build and deploy an application that runs reliably even under heavy load and with large amounts of data. It includes the following features:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Persistent storage with queries, sorting, and transactions.</li>\n<li>Automatic scaling and load balancing.</li>\n<li>Asynchronous task queues for performing work outside the scope of a request.</li>\n<li>Scheduled tasks for triggering events at specified times or regular intervals.</li>\n<li>Integration with other Google cloud services and APIs.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>As of March 5th, 2012, <a href="https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/google-appengine-java/8zQtq_m9W5w" rel="nofollow">Stack Overflow is Google\'s official community support channel for technical App Engine questions</a> under the <a href="/questions/tagged/google-app-engine" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'google-app-engine\'" rel="tag"><img src="http://i.stack.imgur.com/vobok.png" height="16" width="18" alt="" class="sponsor-tag-img">google-app-engine</a> tag. WordPress questions about programming and administration are best asked on http://wordpress.stackexchange.com/</p>\r\n            </div>\r\n<p><strong><a href="http://wordpress.org/" rel="nofollow">WordPress</a></strong> is a PHP-based, open source content management system (<a href="/questions/tagged/cms" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged \'cms\'" rel="tag">cms</a>) for creating websites and blogs. Through its dynamic presentation of content, webmasters have the flexibility to create beautiful and useful websites easily. Through its system of filters and hooks, WordPress allows developers to extend functionality through pieces of code called functions, which can be grouped into separate executables called "plugins".</p>\n\n<p>WordPress as a content management platform should be distinguished from <a href="http://wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">wordpress.com</a>, which is a hosted solution by the creators of WordPress. For a discussion of the differences, visit <a href="http://en.support.wordpress.com/com-vs-org/" rel="nofollow">WordPress.com and WordPress.org</a>. The latest version is WordPress 4.0 \u201cBenny\u201d released September 4, 2014.</p>\n\n<p>This tag is for programming-specific questions related to WordPress, especially those that involve a mix of languages and technologies (PHP, MySQL, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery and others). 2015-01-03 09:40:34+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Crawled (200) <GET http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27743917/is-pythons-an-equivalence-relation-on-the-floats> (referer: http://stackoverflow.com/questions?page=2&sort=active)
2015-01-03 09:40:34+0000 [stackoverflow] DEBUG: Scraped from <200 http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27743917/is-pythons-an-equivalence-relation-on-the-floats>
	{'answers': [{'accept': False,
	              'body': u'<p><code>==</code> is reflexive for all numbers, zero, -zero, ininity, and -infinity, but not for nan.</p>\n\n<p>You can get <code>inf</code>, <code>-inf</code>, and <code>nan</code> in native Python just by arithmetic operations on literals, like below.</p>\n\n<p>These behave correctly, as in IEEE 754 and without math domain exception:</p>\n\n<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; 1e1000 == 1e1000\nTrue\n&gt;&gt;&gt; 1e1000/1e1000 == 1e1000/1e1000\nFalse\n</code></pre>\n\n<p><code>1e1000</code> is a very big number, so float and double represent it as an infinity.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>infinity is equal to infinity</li>\n<li>infinity divided by infinity is not a number</li>\n<li>not a number != not a number</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>Floating-point arithmetic in Python also works OK for infinity minus infinity etc.:</p>\n\n<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; x = 1e1000\n&gt;&gt;&gt; x\ninf\n&gt;&gt;&gt; x+x\ninf\n&gt;&gt;&gt; x-x\nnan\n&gt;&gt;&gt; x*2\ninf\n&gt;&gt;&gt; x == x\nTrue\n&gt;&gt;&gt; x-x == x-x\nFalse\n&gt;&gt;&gt; \n</code></pre>\n\n<p>And for the zero and minus zero case:</p>\n\n<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; inf = float("inf")\n&gt;&gt;&gt; 1/inf\n0.0\n&gt;&gt;&gt; -1/inf\n-0.0\n&gt;&gt;&gt; -1/inf == 1/inf\nTrue\n&gt;&gt;&gt; \n</code></pre>',
	              'comments': [u'For completeness, it might be helpful to include the (short) list of axioms that makes an equivalence relation. Also, you never actually explicitly say it is not an equivalence relation, you simply say that it is not reflexive for ',
	                           u'.'],
	              'extid': 27744584,
	              'url': 'http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27743917/is-pythons-an-equivalence-relation-on-the-floats/27744584#27744584',
	              'user_id': 122718,
	              'vote': 25},
	             {'accept': False,
	              'body': u'<p><code>float(\'nan\')</code> exists in native Python and <code>float(\'nan\') != float(\'nan\')</code>. So no, <code>==</code> is not an <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Equivalence_relation#Definition">equivalence relation</a> since it lacks reflexivity:</p>\n\n<pre><code>In [40]: float(\'nan\') == float(\'nan\')\nOut[40]: False\n</code></pre>',
	              'comments': [],
	              'extid': 27743974,
	              'url': 'http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27743917/is-pythons-an-equivalence-relation-on-the-floats/27743974#27743974',
	              'user_id': 190597,
	              'vote': 23}],
	 'body': u"<p>In native Python, without using NumPy (for which <code>numpy.nan != numpy.nan</code>) there is no NaN, so am I right in thinking that Python's floating point <code>==</code> is reflexive? Then since it is symmetric (<code>a == b</code> implies <code>b == a</code>) and transitive (if <code>a==b</code> and <code>b==c</code> then <code>a==c</code>), can we say that Python's <code>==</code> is an equivalence relation on the <code>float</code>s?</p>\n\n<p>EDIT: OK, so I learned that there <em>is</em> a NaN: <code>float('nan')</code> (thanks @unutbu) which will propagate through various operations, but does any native Python method return it (rather than raising an Exception) without me introducing it by this assignment?</p>",
	 'comments': [u'I did not know this: thank you. Is ',
